channel.title: Command Help
channel.description: Okay well i've been playing around with my command... And i got this Mistake. All i want it to do is, when you type in ::help You teleport to a place and then it says (the server) PLAYERNAME is at ::help Thankz... _____________________________________________________________________________________________________ [img]http://www.runetower.com/signatures/pose6/background20/SSBBbSBEZWRpY2F0ZWQgMiBIYXplUGt6/Omar.png[/img] [img]http://www.runetower.com/signatures/pose9/background15/QWxsIEpvaW4gSGF6ZVBreiBOb3ch/Omar.png[/img]

item.title: Command Help
item.dc:creator: @Kayceee Kayceee
item.description:
@Kayceee wrote:

Lol umm, I’m not going to write the whole thing out for you as you need to learn!
But, find or create a new command and you want to include these:

toX = (YOUR X COORDS OF WHERE YOU WANT TO TELE)
toY = (YOUR Y COORDS OF WHERE YOU WANT TO TELE)
or if your voids are different then you want to put:
teletoX = (YOUR X COORDS OF WHERE YOU WANT TO TELE)
teletoY = (YOUR Y COORDS OF WHERE YOU WANT TO TELE)

Don’t use both.

And you want a message sending to everyone or a message sending to the player who typed ::help?
If it’s for the player who typed help you want to include:

sM("+PlayerName+ has just arrived at ::help!");
OR
SendMessage("+PlayerName has just arrived at ::help!");

Sorry if any of it appears to be wrong! :o

Read full topic
